front.title: Using HTTPS for Privacy Between DNS Stub and Recursive Resolvers

abstract.t: DNS queries and responses can contain information that reveals important information about the person who caused the queries, and it would be better if eavesdroppers were unable to see DNS traffic. This document describes how to use TLS for encrypting DNS traffic between a system acting as a DNS stub resolver and a system acting as a DNS recursive resolver. It defines how to easily wrap DNS queries in HTTP requests and interpret DNS responses in the HTTP respones; the HTTP here is always run under TLS on port 443. Discussion of this draft should take place in the DPRIVE WG.
